alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 8:23AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 900 AM MDT... At 823 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles northeast of Kit Carson, or 17 miles west of Cheyenne Wells, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Firstview. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 136 and 145. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
